intro: Tibouchina ochypetala, commonly known as the purplebark or pink tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tibouchina ochypetala thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
